getxattr

public int getxattr(java.lang.String path,
                    java.lang.String name,
                    java.nio.ByteBuffer dst)
             throws FuseException,
                    java.nio.BufferOverflowException
This method will be called to get the value of the extended attribute

Specified by:
getxattr in interface XattrSupport
Parameters:
path - the path to file or directory containing extended attribute
name - the name of the extended attribute
dst - a ByteBuffer that should be filled with the value of the extended attribute
Returns:
0 if Ok or errno when error
Throws:
FuseException - an alternative to returning errno is to throw this exception with errno initialized
java.nio.BufferOverflowException - should be thrown to indicate that the given dst ByteBuffer is not large enough to hold the attribute's value. After that getxattr() method will be called again with a larger buffer.

                        java.lang.String name,
                        FuseSizeSetter sizeSetter)
                 throws FuseException

Specified by:
getxattrsize in interface XattrSupport
Parameters:
path - the path to file or directory containing extended attribute
name - the name of the extended attribute
sizeSetter - a callback interface that should be used to set the attribute's size
Returns:
0 if Ok or errno when error
Throws:
FuseException - an alternative to returning errno is to throw this exception with errno initialized

setxattr

public int setxattr(java.lang.String path,
                    java.lang.String name,
                    java.nio.ByteBuffer value,
                    int flags)
             throws FuseException
This method will be called to set the value of an extended attribute

Specified by:
setxattr in interface XattrSupport
Parameters:
path - the path to file or directory containing extended attributes
name - the name of the extended attribute
value - the value of the extended attribute
flags - parameter can be used to refine the semantics of the operation.

XATTR_CREATE specifies a pure create, which should fail with Errno.EEXIST if the named attribute exists already.

XATTR_REPLACE specifies a pure replace operation, which should fail with Errno.ENOATTR if the named attribute does not already exist.

By default (no flags), the extended attribute will be created if need be, or will simply replace the value if the attribute exists.

Returns:
0 if Ok or errno when error
Throws:
FuseException - an alternative to returning errno is to throw this exception with errno initialized

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
